translation.en: [Arnold] My whole life,
I had this
unusual talent
that I could see things very clearly
translation.ko: 눈앞의 일을 아주 명확히 볼 수 있는

translation.en: in front of me.
If I can see it,
then it must be achievable.
The idea was
to sculpt the body
to your will.
But it also can be used to shape your mind,
translation.ko: 동시에 그를 통해 정신도 단련할 수 있어요

translation.en: to do the things that everyone calls impossible.
translation.ko: 모두가 불가능하다는 일을 해낼 수도 있고요

translation.en: And that gives you the will…
I'll be back.
…and no doubt
that you can make your visions,
not only become a reality,
but go beyond your dreams.
I had a fire in the belly
for much more.
Much, much more.
[man] If I had to describe Arnold in one word,
I would say he's the most calculating individual that I've ever come across.
translation.ko: 제가 만나 본 사람 중에 가장 계산적인 사람이에요

translation.en: He's the most competitive maniac I've ever met.
translation.ko: 내가 만난 사람 중에 가장 경쟁에 미쳐 있죠

translation.en: [woman] He is, just, magic.
If Arnold is showing up on set,
you better up your game.
[man] We couldn't even stand to breathe the same air.
translation.ko: 같은 공기를 마시는 것조차 참을 수 없었어요

translation.en: He broke every damn rule there was.
[woman 2] Arnold believed that a crisis is a terrible thing to waste.
[man 2] Arnold sold Arnold.
[man 3] He gets the joke of the universe.
Bullshit.
[announcer] Ladies and gentlemen, from Austria,
welcome to our stage, please, Mr. Arnold Schwarzenegger.
translation.ko: 박수로 맞아 주십시오 아놀드 슈워제네거 씨

translation.en: [announcer 2] Look now, Arnold Schwarzenegger, 22 years of age.
Now living in Los Angeles.
Weighs almost 230 pounds.
He works out several hours a day.
This is his life. He's a professional.
When he's not doing this, he'll be touring the world,
translation.ko: 대회에 출전하지 않을 땐 세계를 돌면서

translation.en: putting on exhibitions.
Listen to that crowd react to him.
And there you have it!
Arnold Schwarzenegger from Austria.
Seven judges observe specific points of muscular development and presentation.
translation.ko: 심사 위원 7명이 근육 발달 상태와 포즈를 관찰합니다

translation.en: [announcer] In position number one,
Mr. Arnold Schwarzenegger.
[announcer 2] And the winner!
What a big day for this youngster.
[Arnold] When I was in school already, I felt like I didn't belong here.
translation.ko: 학교에 다닐 때부터 내가 있을 곳은 여기가 아니라

translation.en: I belonged somewhere else.
That's not the life I want to live, like the Austrians live their life,
translation.ko: 오스트리아에서의 삶은 제가 원하는 삶이 아니었죠

translation.en: which is, you know,
go to school until 18 and get married, have kids.
Just work to support your family.
I thought that my purpose for life was just far beyond that.
translation.ko: 내 인생의 목적은 그 너머에 있는 것 같았죠

translation.en: [Arnold] I always liked coming back here.
translation.ko: 전 여기에 오는 걸 늘 좋아했어요

translation.en: Each time you come, you look from a different point of view,
translation.ko: 올 때마다 다른 관점으로 보게 되죠

translation.en: through a different lens.
It was very important, every time I came to Austria,
translation.ko: 그래서 오스트리아에 올 일이 있을 때면

translation.en: even to promote my movies or bodybuilding,
or whatever…
I always came back down here to Thal.
I think it's always good to stay in touch with your roots and where you come from.
translation.ko: 자신이 난 뿌리와 닿아 있는 건 늘 좋은 일이죠

translation.en: Thal is a beautiful, beautiful place.
The house where I grew up
was surrounded by farms.
We had a castle across the street,
built in the 1100s.
So this was our playground. So it was absolutely beautiful.
Our house was an old house.
It was built in the beginning of 1800s.
Downstairs lived the forest ranger.
We had the upstairs of that old house.
translation.ko: 우리 가족은 그 오래된 집의 위층에 살았어요

translation.en: My mother was hardworking.
Aurelia.
She would never, ever pull back.
She was a cleanliness fanatic.
I'm telling you, she was on her knees
twice a week,
scrubbing the floor.
And then, when you open up the cabinet
with the towels,
it was perfectly placed.
There was an edge.
Bang. Bang. Bang.
If my father would touch that,
she would go nuts.
This is what a fanatic she was.
Growing up, I'll tell you what I learned.
"Work your ass off."
My father was the chief of the country police.
He was a tyrant and a very tough police officer.
There was no screwing around.
My dad thought they should create some discipline in the house.
translation.ko: 아버지는 집에 기강을 잡아야 한다고 생각했고

translation.en: He said you have to earn breakfast.
translation.ko: 아침 먹을 자격을 얻어야 한다고 하셨죠

translation.en: I had a very good relationship with my brother,
but it was a competitive relationship.
I mean, he was a year older, my brother.
More muscular, smarter.
He was very good in school.
My father also made us compete against each other.
Who runs faster?
Who picks more beautiful flowers on Mother's Day?
translation.ko: 누가 어머니날에 예쁜 꽃을 더 많이 꺾나?

translation.en: My father says, "I'll give you one hour."
My brother would come home with his flowers.
translation.ko: 그럼 형은 꽃을 꺾어서 집에 왔고

translation.en: My father says, "Meinhard, good boy. Very, very good."
"Arnold, next year you will try it again."
So it was competitive. Even stupid things like that.
translation.ko: 그렇게 별것 아닌 것도 다 경쟁이었죠

translation.en: My father gave me that drive he gave me that fire in the belly,
translation.ko: 아버지는 제게 그런 투지와 열정을 줬고

translation.en: and then with the message,
"Whatever you do, Arnold,
be useful."
The way I grew up, it was very tough, even though it was beautiful countryside.
translation.ko: 그렇게 아름다운 시골 동네에서 아버지는 절 아주 엄하게 키웠어요

translation.en: But to grow up after a war…
translation.ko: 하지만 전쟁이 끝난 뒤 자라는 건…

translation.en: What happens to your head
when you come home from war
suffering the post-traumatic stress syndrome,
translation.ko: 외상 후 스트레스 장애에 시달리면 어떻겠어요?

translation.en: like my father?
He was buried underneath buildings, rubble, for three days,
translation.ko: 아버지는 무너진 건물 잔해에 사흘이나 깔려 있었어요

translation.en: and on top of that, they lost the war.
They went home so depressed.
Austria was a country of broken men.
I think there were times when my father really struggled.
translation.ko: 아버지가 정말 힘들었던 시기가 있었던 것 같아요

translation.en: When we got smacked,
or my father would use the belt and hit us.
The kid next door was hit also by his father.
Everyone was going through the same thing.
As I was getting older,
and the more I read stuff about the outside world,
translation.ko: 오스트리아 밖의 세상에 관해 알게 될수록

translation.en: outside of Austria, the more I started feeling like,
translation.ko: 오스트리아 밖의 세상에 관해 알게 될수록 이런 생각이 들었어요

translation.en: "I don't think that I was brought up in the right place."
"There's something off here."
And I know this sounds crazy, but for a while,
I thought, "Maybe my dad isn't really my dad."
"Maybe it's some American soldier."
I checked into it. I said, "Where does this come from?"
"My desire that I really
maybe don't belong to Austria?"
"Maybe I belong to America. Why is that?"
translation.ko: '미국으로 가고 싶은 열망이 생기는 건 왜일까?'

translation.en: That's what convinced me that one day I have to be over there.
translation.ko: 언젠간 그곳에 가야 한다는 확신이 생겼어요

translation.en: I'm in the wrong place.
"I gotta get out of here."
When my brother and I went to town in Graz…
that was the first time we had exposure to the city.
After school, kind of walked around in town a little bit
and we saw the movie theaters.
This ad that was out there in front
of this guy standing like this.
I was kind of, like, in a trance.
Who is that?
[movie narrator] Hercules and the Captive Women.
Here at last,
with a new and dynamic personality.
Reg Park as Hercules.
Superhuman strength.
[Arnold] I went in there and I saw this body,
and I was so amazed at this body that I could not get it out of my mind.
The testosterone was kicking in.
Getting interested in girls was kicking in.
Everything started happening.
And then I walked by a store.
There was all this American stuff.
One of the things was muscle magazines from America.
This guy Reg Park who I saw in the movies,
translation.ko: 영화에서 봤던 레지 파크가 보이는 거예요

translation.en: he's on the cover.
Inside, it has his training program.
translation.ko: 안에는 레지 파크의 운동 프로그램이 나와 있었어요

translation.en: He was up at 5:00 in the morning. He was training.
And then he was training a second time. And then a third time.
I have to do that.
It said how he became Mr. Universe
and how he was discovered in Rome to become Hercules.
translation.ko: 로마에서 눈에 띄어 헤라클레스로 발탁된 과정도요

translation.en: So I said, "Oh my God."
"This guy is my idol."
So he was kind of like my blueprint
translation.ko: 즉, 내가 갈 길을 알려 주는

translation.en: to where I want to go in life.
My drive to come to America was enormous.
translation.ko: 미국으로 가겠다는 제 의지는 정말 강했어요

translation.en: And if you're willing to put the hours behind it,
then you have to really find out what is it,
where your talent lies.
Where are you good at?
To me, bodybuilding represented a sport that is American.
The feedback that I got in the gym was enormous,
so that's why I knew this is the direction that I wanted to go.
translation.ko: 이 길이 내 길이라는 걸 확신하게 됐죠

translation.en: I would be working out in my house.
There was no sound.
Nothing.
And I could think and concentrate
translation.ko: 덕분에 보디빌딩 챔피언이 된 제 모습을 그려보고

translation.en: and visualize how I'm gonna become a bodybuilding champion.
translation.ko: 덕분에 보디빌딩 챔피언이 된 제 모습을 그려보고 생각하고 집중할 수 있었습니다

translation.en: How I'm gonna move to America.
How I'm gonna get into the movies.
How I'm gonna make millions of dollars.
[Arnold] The Thalersee, the lake, was a magical scene.
Hanging out with professional wrestlers,
weightlifters,
bodybuilders,
people with muscles.
I met Mr. Austria,
Kurt Marnul,
and walking around with these nice-looking girls
and pulling up in his little Alfa Romeo sports car.
I found this very impressive.
I just all the sudden became part of that clique.
translation.ko: 전 갑자기 그 무리의 일원이 됐어요

translation.en: I was like the young kid that they were adopting.
[Arnold] I think, ever since then, I kind of celebrated this camaraderie.
translation.ko: 그 이후로 전 이런 동료애를 찬양했어요

translation.en: And because I admired it so much, I created that no matter where I went.
translation.ko: 너무나 동경했던 나머지 어딜 가든 그런 무리를 만들었죠

translation.en: My father was negative, because it was not the typical thing to do.
The typical thing to do is you become a soccer player
translation.ko: 일반적인 일이라 하면 축구 선수가 된다거나

translation.en: or you become a ski champion.
This is Austrian.
What the hell are you doing with weightlifting?
And you're looking in the mirror when you train.
What is that all about?
Which means, like, into yourself.
He says, "If you want to use your muscles, go chop wood."
translation.ko: 근육을 쓰고 싶으면 가서 나무를 패라고 하셨어요

translation.en: And my mother got freaked out.
"All his friends,
they have, you know,
girls above their bed."
"My son doesn't have one girl up here. Look at that."
translation.ko: '우리 아들은 여자 사진이 한 장도 없네'

translation.en: "Not one girl. I mean, it's only naked men oiled up."
"Where did we do wrong?"
[man in German] In the beginning, Arnold wasn't a leader.
translation.ko: 아놀드가 처음 왔을 땐 대장이 아니었어요

translation.en: He adapted to us.
But within a year,
I think he gained 15.2 kilos.
When you're in Arnold's company,
you get the impression that everything is easy
translation.ko: 모든 게 쉽고 순조로운 것 같은

translation.en: and there are no problems.
My father often came along,
and he recognized Arnold's potential.
[Arnold in English] Freddy Gerstl, the father, became kind of like a real big supporter.
translation.ko: 알프레트 게르스틀은 큰 지원군이 돼 줬어요

translation.en: He said, "You have to have not only just the strong muscles,
like you guys are doing, but also you have to have a strong mind."
translation.ko: 이렇게 말씀하셨죠 '근육만 단련할 게 아니라' '정신도 단련해야 한다'

translation.en: The body doesn't operate by itself. It operates because you give it direction.
translation.ko: 몸은 저절로 움직이지 않아요 방향을 제시해 줘야 하죠

translation.en: He says, "Remember one thing."
"That you can get an injury, and then all the athletic stuff is over.
"You can have millions of dollars."
"Someone can rob you blind, and it's gone."
"But the only thing no one can take is your mind."
translation.ko: '아무도 못 훔치는 건 단 하나 바로 정신이다'

translation.en: "Your brain power."
"Your mind, your will,
is, in the end, much more important than the body."
He was the father figure quite the opposite from my father.
translation.ko: 그분은 우리 아버지와 정반대의 아버지 같은 존재였어요

translation.en: Unlike my father, who criticized everything,
translation.ko: 모든 걸 비난하던 우리 아버지와 달리

translation.en: that guy was more the understanding father
that understood and he kind of smoothly would you in the right direction,
translation.ko: 날 이해해 주고 옳은 방향으로 부드럽게 이끌었어요

translation.en: rather than forcing you.
I always hear this voice behind me saying,
"Be hungry for information."
[Arnold] I joined the weight lifting club called Athletik Union Graz.
translation.ko: 그라츠 운동 연합이라는 역도 클럽에 가입했어요

translation.en: The guys from the lake also were training there.
translation.ko: 호수에서 만난 친구들도 거기서 운동하고 있었죠

translation.en: So I could train, finally, with the big boys.
translation.ko: 전 마침내 거물들과 함께 훈련하게 됐어요

translation.en: That's where Kurt Marnul was training.
This weightlifting club became, for me, the mecca.
translation.ko: 이 역도 클럽은 제게 메카와 같은 곳이 됐어요

translation.en: I became addicted to that,
and so I went every day.
When I walked into the gym, there was this wall that was wood.
translation.ko: 역도 클럽에 들어서면 목재로 된 벽이 있었어요

translation.en: And then I would just take a chalk
and I would write down
bizeps,
trizeps,
brust, rücken.
So I would do a set of biceps curls.
translation.ko: 그리고 이두 컬을 한 세트 하죠

translation.en: Then I would write down next to this, one line.
translation.ko: 한 세트가 끝나면 옆에 한 줄을 그어요

translation.en: Then I would put another line and then another line and another line.
translation.ko: 그렇게 한 줄씩 긋고 또 긋죠

translation.en: Then, the next one.
Flies on the bench.
And I'd know when I did my 20 sets of a specific exercise.
Now after three hours of training, this whole thing would be full of sets that I've done…
translation.ko: 세 시간에 걸쳐 전체 운동을 마치면

translation.en: …to get to that goal that I want go.
[Arnold] The bodybuilding, there was, like, maybe, one or two events a year.
translation.ko: 보디빌딩 대회는 일 년에 한두 차례 열렸어요

translation.en: Sometimes there were more than one competition a day.
translation.ko: 하루에 대회가 2개 이상 있을 때도 있었죠

translation.en: Like, Mr. Steíermark, which means Mr. Styria.
translation.ko: 예를 들어 미스터 슈타이어마르크 대회가 열려요

translation.en: And then there would be the Mr. Hercules competition,
translation.ko: 뒤이어 미스터 헤라클레스 대회가 또 열리는데

translation.en: which is usually for the guy that was the most muscular.
They would hire a local band that was really, like, hot.
translation.ko: 인기 있는 지역 밴드도 섭외하곤 했어요

translation.en: They would have women who were from some exotic place
to give the sport of bodybuilding a better reputation.
Then, there would be a Mr. Austria competition,
which is, of course, the national championships.
♪ Whoo! ♪
[Arnold] This was a place where I spent a lot of time,
right here in this bed and in this room.
So I would be just literally, you know, lying here
like this.
And just, you know, hanging here like this
and dreaming.
And then looking up at those characters.
And then sitting up.
I would see Reg Park, you know, with his body,
and then remembering the story
of him growing up in Leeds,
in England.
The town was like Graz.
It was a factory town.
And the people worked hard.
And I said to myself, "He made it out of that?"
"Then there's a chance for me also
to make it out of here."
Then you just look at any opportunity you could have to get out of here.
translation.ko: 그리고 이곳에서 벗어날 기회를 뭐든 찾는 거죠

translation.en: So I think that's the reason I enlisted in the military early.
translation.ko: 일찍 입대한 것도 그 이유인 것 같아요

translation.en: In Austria, everyone serves in the military.
I decided to go at the age of 18.
I wanted to finish my service and then move on,
because you could not get your passport unless you have done your military service.
I wanted to specialize in tank division and to become a tank driver.
translation.ko: 전차 사단에 들어가고 싶었어요 전차 운전병이 되고 싶었죠

translation.en: They said that's impossible. I'm too tall.
translation.ko: 근데 제 키가 너무 커서 안 된다더군요

translation.en: My father knew a few people in the military, so I became a tank driver.
translation.ko: 아버지의 군 지인을 통해서 전차 조종병이 됐어요

translation.en: Then I became the ballsiest tank driver that they had.
translation.ko: 그리고 가장 용맹한 전차 조종병이 됐죠

translation.en: [Arnold] In the middle of basic training,
I got the invitation to go to this competition in Stuttgart, Germany.
European's best-built man, in the junior division.
translation.ko: 유럽 최고의 보디빌더를 뽑는 대회의 주니어 부문이었죠

translation.en: When I asked them, Can I go?" they said no.
translation.ko: 군에 출전 허가를 구했지만 안 된다고 했죠

translation.en: I did not realize
that when you're in the middle of the basic training, you are not allowed to leave.
translation.ko: 신병 훈련 중엔 나가는 게 금지였어요

translation.en: I went anyway.
[Arnold] Twenty-eight guys on the stage,
and I win.
I saw my career in front of me.
I saw myself on that Mr. Universe stage.
translation.ko: 미스터 유니버스 대회에 선 제 모습이 보였죠

translation.en: I just had to replace Reg Park's head,
put my head on it, and stand there with the trophy
translation.ko: 제 얼굴로만 바꾸면 됐어요 트로피를 들고

translation.en: and flex my muscles.
And I saw
the thousands of people
in the auditorium, in the theater, screaming,
"Arnold! Arnold! Arnold!"
[Arnold] I saw the fantasy,
and it's not a dream.
I said, "No, fuck the dream. What are you gonna do with a dream?"
translation.ko: '꿈 따위 개나 줘 꿈으로 뭘 할 수 있는데?'

translation.en: "You have to have a clear vision."
And when you visualize something really clearly,
you believe that you 100% can get there.
My very first impression was
this is the most outstanding junior I ever saw in my life,
translation.ko: 제가 본 중 가장 뛰어난 주니어 선수라는 거였습니다

translation.en: because he had it all.
He had a kind of charisma very unusual for that age.
He owned the stage
already then.
I talked to him, "What do you think to come to Munich
as trainer in the gym I manage?"
[Arnold] I was supposed to be in the military for three years.
So I had to ask if I can leave early.
That position that was offered to me
to become a trainer in a bodybuilding gym in Germany,
was very appealing.
And it was kind of really the only solution
to get me out of Austria and one step closer to America.
translation.ko: 오스트리아를 벗어나 미국으로 한발 다가갈 기회였죠

translation.en: You're not gonna go and become the greatest bodybuilder of all time in Austria,
translation.ko: 오스트리아에서는 역대 최고의 보디빌더가 될 수 없어요

translation.en: because you need to train with the best bodybuilders around you,
and the mecca of bodybuilding was America.
"I got to get out of here, no matter what it takes."
[Arnold] I don't look at it as, "Oh my God."
"What a terrible upbringing I had."
No.
What I hated as a kid was good,
translation.ko: 어릴 때 싫어한 것이 득이 됐죠

translation.en: because that's what drove me to get out of there.
All right, let's feed the girls.
Uno, Misty!
Uno, Misty!
I could train longer than anyone else.
I could go through misery when I traveled to other countries.
translation.ko: 다른 나라를 여행할 때 그 고생을 다 견디고

translation.en: I was able to do things that others couldn't do
translation.ko: 남들이 못하는 것을 할 수 있었던 게

translation.en: because of that.
Ah, pushing him out of the way.
It didn't bother me,
because it was better than where I came from.
[Arnold] When I arrived in Munich,
my friend Albert Busek picked me up from the train station,
and I moved into the gym.
There was a tiny little room,
and my bed maybe was as big as the bed that I grew up with.
translation.ko: 어릴 때 쓰던 것만 한 침대가 놓여 있었어요

translation.en: All I had was a mixer that helped me mix my protein drinks
translation.ko: 있는 거라고는 단백질 음료를 만들 믹서기와

translation.en: and a few clothes.
That was it.
And I stayed there for at least a year.
So, at any given time,
I can go out and work out.
I mean, how lucky of a son of a bitch am I to have the gym be my home?
translation.ko: 집이 헬스장이라니 얼마나 운 좋은 놈입니까?

translation.en: I then developed my own little family,
which was Albert Busek
and Franco Columbu,
who I met the year before in Stuttgart.
He was the perfect training partner,
and he was one of the very few Italians that spoke German.
[Franco] He comes from Austria. I came from Italy.
And we started training together and having fun.
Since then, I'm one of Arnold's best friends.
translation.ko: "프란코 콜룸부, 보디빌더 1976년, 1981년 미스터 올림피아" 그때부터 전 아놀드의 절친한 친구예요

translation.en: I messed it up.
Say that again.
♪ Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa… ♪
[Arnold] My friends helped me to raise money for an airline ticket
translation.ko: 친구들 도움으로 비행기표 살 돈을 모아서

translation.en: to compete in the Mr. Universe contest.
[Arnold] So imagine, just a few months before, you're in the military.
translation.ko: 상상해 보세요 몇 달 전만 해도 군대에 있다가

translation.en: And now you're traveling to London to go to the Mr. Universe contest.
translation.ko: 미스터 유니버스 대회에 출전하러 런던으로 가는 거예요

translation.en: My goal was to place in the top six,
but I placed second
with the age of 19.
I said, "Oh my God."
"If I'm winning second
as this little farm boy from Austria that has no experience,
next year I'm gonna win!"
[Albert] Arnold was so gifted
that regular people, the fans of bodybuilding, knew
this is the future.
[Arnold] At the Mr. Universe competition,
one of the judges was a man by the name of Wag Bennett.
translation.ko: 심사 위원 중에 왜그 베넷이라는 사람이 있었어요

translation.en: And he'd say… [imitating Wag] "Arnold, you look fantastic. You look fantastic." "It's absolutely marvelous."
All this British stuff, right?
He invited us to a dinner,
and he's a judge, so I thought, "This is so unbelievable."
translation.ko: 심사 위원의 초대에 전 정말 기뻤어요

translation.en: My English was terrible then,
so we always were laughing about it.
Wag then said to me, "Well, if you ever come back, you can stay with us."
translation.ko: 왜그는 런던에 또 오면 자기 집에서 지내라고 했어요

translation.en: "You don't have to stay in a hotel."
The next year,
Wag organized the competition
and he paid for the airline ticket to fly over there.
translation.ko: 대회 출전을 위한 비행기표를 끊어 줬어요

translation.en: So I was at the Bennett's house in London,
translation.ko: 전 런던에 있는 왜그의 집에서 지냈어요

translation.en: on 335 Romford Road.
I remember it exactly.
And in walked Reg Park.
Meeting Reg Park
was, like, one of those extraordinary moments.
You see him in magazines.
You see him in movies.
And then all of a sudden, there he is.
He just came from South Africa and he wants to work out.
translation.ko: 남아프리카에서 갓 돌아와서 운동을 하고 싶어 했어요

translation.en: And then we're working out together.
I remember that he didn't even… he didn't even take off his sweater.
translation.ko: 레지 파크가 스웨터도 벗지 않았던 게 기억나요

translation.en: And it was just extraordinary to see Hercules
that you saw in the movies, to see him in front of you,
translation.ko: 영화 속 인물이 눈앞에 나타난 거잖아요

translation.en: and then to have a conversation and to have him be so nice.
He knew everything about me,
because Wag Bennett told him.
To really motivate me, he said to me,
"If you win the Mr. Universe contest,
I'm gonna bring you down to South Africa."
"And I'm gonna have you do posing exhibitions." I'm gonna pay you for each positing exhibition."
translation.ko: '네 포즈 쇼를 열어 줄 거고 출연료를 꼬박꼬박 줄 거야'

translation.en: "You can make some money there, and you're gonna see the entire country."
translation.ko: '큰돈을 벌 거고 전국을 돌게 될 거다'

translation.en: [Arnold] There's no room for mistakes,
because I have to be Mr. Universe in 1967.
Wag would say, "You gotta train your calves."
"Your biceps are much larger than your calves."
"The calves are skinny, and the whole proportion is off."
If you want to win,
you need to be fine-tuned and you have to have everything at ten.
translation.ko: '미세한 것까지 신경 써서 모든 게 만점이 돼야 해'

translation.en: Finally, it all came together.
[announcer] And the winner,
Arnold Schwarzenegger!
[Arnold] At the age of 20,
I made my vision
become a reality.
On that very same stage that Reg Park won it,
translation.ko: 레지 파크가 우승한 바로 그 무대에서

translation.en: and I got exactly the same trophy that he got.
translation.ko: 레지 파크가 받은 똑같은 트로피를 받았죠

translation.en: And exactly the way I envisioned it.
All the people were screaming.
[Arnold] I felt like, "This is like a fairy tale."
Everything falls into place.
Reg Park invites me to Johannesburg
to stay in his house.
Do you know what that did to me?
I'm getting invited by my idol to go to his home turf.
[man] I met Arnold when he came here.
I was, uh, nine at the time.
He was very polite. He was well-mannered.
He would wear sandals and socks, you know?
translation.ko: "존 존 파크 트레이너, 레지 파크의 아들" 샌들에 양말을 신고 있었죠

translation.en: Like a country bumpkin, so to speak.
Lily-white skin. Everybody on the beach had a tan.
translation.ko: 피부가 새하얬어요 다들 해변에서 태닝을 했는데요

translation.en: I remember him almost being in awe,
translation.ko: 아놀드는 감탄을 넘어 겁에 질린 지경이었는데

translation.en: but my dad made him feel so comfortable.
My mother, you know, of course, made him feel so comfortable as well.
He immediately became part of the family.
We'd go out to meals together every night and go to movies.
translation.ko: 매일 저녁을 함께 먹고 영화관에도 갔죠

translation.en: What he really learned from my parents was how important family was.
translation.ko: 아놀드는 우리 부모님에게 가족의 소중함을 배웠어요

translation.en: I think that impressed him more than anything else.
translation.ko: 거기에 가장 큰 감명을 받은 것 같아요

translation.en: My mother gave Arnold some pointers.
You know, he could do the basic poses, but there was no flow and transition.
translation.ko: 기본 포즈는 잘했지만 흐름과 전환은 부족했거든요

translation.en: So she helped him put his routine together.
[Arnold] Mareon was a ballet teacher.
She taught Reg how to be more graceful on stage.
translation.ko: 레지에게 더 우아하게 포즈를 취하는 법을 가르쳤죠

translation.en: You couldn't get more two opposites. Ballet is all about grace.
translation.ko: 완전 극과 극이에요 발레는 우아함이 생명인데

translation.en: Then you have bodybuilding, which is kind of blocky
and not much movement.
I didn't understand it all,
but then, as time went on, I started utilizing what she taught me.
translation.ko: 시간이 지나면서 메리언에게 배운 걸 활용하기 시작했어요

translation.en: When I was a kid, I was shy,
and bodybuilding
was a sport where you had to perform.
So I could learn it in my own way,
to perform and to pose on stage.
And people then correct you and say, you know, "Smile more when you perform,"
translation.ko: 그럼 사람들이 교정해 주죠 '포즈를 취할 때는 더 웃어라'

translation.en: and do this and do that.
This is how it slowly came about
to become an entertainer
and really enjoying the moment.
In 1968, I went and competed at the Mr. Universe contest in London.
Every time they called out a pose…
If I did a double bicep pose, I had the biggest biceps.
translation.ko: 전 양팔 이두근 포즈를 취했는데 제 이두근이 가장 컸어요

translation.en: Then, when we turned around and do a back pose,
translation.ko: 그리고 뒤돌아서 등 포즈를 취할 땐

translation.en: there's no one that's going to have this kind of a back.
translation.ko: 저 같은 등을 가진 사람은 아무도 없었죠

translation.en: So I knew I'm gonna win.
I win the second Mr. Universe title. I feel, like, at an all-time high.
translation.ko: 미스터 유니버스 두 번째 우승에 기분이 하늘을 날았어요

translation.en: And I'm about to go back to Munich,
when I get a telegram
from Joe Weider.
I said to myself, "Oh my God."
translation.ko: "조 위더 피트니스계의 아이콘" 전 깜짝 놀랐어요

translation.en: "Joe Weider? He's like the godfather of bodybuilding."
The trainer of champions since 1939.
All of the guys that win Mr. Universe and Mr. World,
translation.ko: 미스터 유니버스와 미스터 월드 우승자들은 모두

translation.en: they have been trained by Joe Weider.
And it says in the telegram,
"I'm inviting you to come to Miami to our Mr. Universe competition,"
translation.ko: '우리 미스터 유니버스 대회에 출전하러 마이애미로 와라'

translation.en: because there was two.
Weider started a Mr. Universe in the 60s in America.
translation.ko: 위더는 60년대 미국에서 미스터 유니버스 대회를 시작했죠

translation.en: I didn't go back home. I didn't pick up any of my belongings.
translation.ko: 전 집에 돌아가지 않았고 짐도 전혀 챙기지 않았어요

translation.en: I called Albert and I called Franco and said, "Look."
"I just got an invitation from Weider. I'm not coming back."
"I'm gonna move to America."
"Bye-bye."
♪ I got the feelin' ♪
When I came to America, I felt like…
…finally, I'm in my home.
♪ Baby, baby, baby… ♪
Then we got flew down to Florida.
[Arnold] I was absolutely convinced
that I'm gonna beat all the American bodybuilders.
Set me up as kind of, like, the new champion.
Become the greatest bodybuilder of all times.
translation.ko: 역대 최고의 보디빌더가 될 자신이 있었죠

translation.en: He was acting so arrogant and cocky like the winner, but he wasn't in shape,
translation.ko: 아놀드는 우승자가 된 양 건방지고 우쭐댔지만 몸이 완벽하지 않았어요

translation.en: because it was all about being big and, you know, size with him.
[Arnold] And when they announced the fourth place, third place,
and the second place, Arnold Schwarzenegger.
Oh, fuck.
This can't be.
I once was considered the unbeatable guy, and now, all of a sudden, Frank Zane won.
translation.ko: 전 적수가 없는 사람이었는데 뜬금없이 프랭크 제인이 우승했죠

translation.en: This is terrible. I'm embarrassed.
[Frank] I think he was just used to winning all the time.
translation.ko: 아놀드는 늘 이기는 데 익숙했던 것 같아요

translation.en: Landing in this country the first time, getting defeated
translation.ko: 이 나라에 처음 와서 패배를 맛본 상대가

translation.en: by, as his words,
"a chicken with 17-inch arms,"
that really bothered him.
[Arnold] I was so devastated.
I was lying there in the middle of the night in bed
in this hotel room,
and I thought the world is coming to an end.
I'm in a strange country.
I cannot communicate here.
I'm thousands of miles away from home.
And I just lost.
I just disappointed everybody.
So in my mind, the bodybuilding world was going to say,
"Schwarzenegger is not what we thought he is."
"So fuck him."
I cried the whole night.
The next day, I said, "Okay."
"You cried like a little baby, you asshole."
"And now, let's move on."
And then Weider gave me an airline ticket to go to Los Angeles.
He's gonna take care of things and he's gonna get me an apartment.
translation.ko: 위더가 이런저런 일을 처리해 주고 집을 구해 주기로 했죠

translation.en: I wrote to my friends right away. I said, "This is quite different."
translation.ko: 전 곧장 친구들에게 편지를 썼어요 '여기는 다르다'

translation.en: I felt, like, totally helpless
and alone.
The gyms that I went to
were gyms where the best bodybuilders worked out.
I come in there and I want to work out.
And there's guys that owned the gym, like, Vince Gironda,
translation.ko: 헬스장 운영자들이 있었는데 그중 빈스 지론다는

translation.en: he owned Vince's Gym.
He says, "You're still a baby."
"We have to get rid of a lot of fat on you,
translation.ko: '네 몸에 붙은 지방을 많이 덜어내야 하지만'

translation.en: but you have a lot of potential."
And I said to myself, "What the fuck is he talking about? Potential?"
Then I trained at Gold's Gym,
and Joe Gold immediately called me "Balloon Belly."
translation.ko: 조 골드가 절 보자마자 '풍선 배'라고 부르더군요

translation.en: I said,
"Jesus."
I realized why it was so important to come to America,
translation.ko: 전 미국에 꼭 와야 하는 이유를 깨달았어요

translation.en: because they just have a whole different understanding
of what it means being in shape.
I alone cannot accomplish anything.
translation.ko: 저 혼자서는 아무것도 할 수 없었어요

translation.en: I need help.
So I invited Frank Zane, the guy that I was beaten by,
translation.ko: 그래서 저를 상대로 이긴 프랭크 제인을

translation.en: to come out to California
and to train with me,
because I wanted to see firsthand
what does he do to get this kind of a quality of a physique.
translation.ko: 뭘 하면 그런 몸이 되는지 보고 싶었죠

translation.en: And I stayed with him on a cot in his living room,
translation.ko: 아놀드 집 거실에 침대를 놓고 지내면서

translation.en: and we'd go to the gym and train.
Go to the beach. Take pictures for Weider.
translation.ko: 해변에도 가고 위더를 위해 사진도 찍었죠

translation.en: I went back to Florida
and resigned my teaching position and moved to California.
[Arnold] And then, when I was training here,
especially in Gold's Gym, I felt like,
translation.ko: 특히 골드 짐에서 이런 생각이 들었어요

translation.en: "Wouldn't it be great if Franco would see what's going on here?"
I mean, he was my close friend and training partner in Munich.
translation.ko: 프란코는 절친한 친구이자 뮌헨에서 훈련 파트너였으니까요

translation.en: I really missed him.
But when Weider heard what his height was, he had no interest at all.
translation.ko: 하지만 위더가 프란코의 키를 듣고 흥미를 보이지 않았어요

translation.en: So he kept saying, "No, I don't want to bring over a little guy like that."
"Come on."
And then eventually Artie Zeller, the photographer, and I,
translation.ko: 하지만 결국 사진작가인 아티 젤러와 제가

translation.en: we kind of convinced him.
And from then, I mean, everything really picked up.
Cinque, sei, sette.
-[groans] -[Arnold] What?
Sette.
Otto.
Nove.
Dieci.
-[laughs] -[Arnold] Okay.
-That's hard. -[Franco] I get it.
-I get it. -[Arnold] Oh, Franco gets it.
translation.ko: - 할 수 있다고 - 프란코는 할 수 있지

translation.en: -Okay, pick it up. -[both laughing]
[Arnold] In that area of building a community,
the talent of mine was actually better
than my talent in bodybuilding.
[Arnold] Gold's Gym in Venice Beach.
Bodybuilders training for championships went there to train.
[Arnold] And then Joe Weider publicized it as the champions' gym.
translation.ko: 조 위더는 그곳을 챔피언들의 헬스장으로 홍보했죠

translation.en: -[man] That nose will look skinny now. -[laughing]
My first impression of him was he was outgoing, funny,
and always cracking jokes.
When he was in the gym, he was focused.
[Frank] It was all energy, and we helped each other.
translation.ko: 헬스장엔 에너지가 넘쳤고 서로 도우며 운동했어요

translation.en: Now, Arnold was a great person to have in the gym when you're working out,
translation.ko: 운동할 때 헬스장에 아놀드가 있으면 참 좋았어요

translation.en: because just his presence made you want to work out harder
just to impress him.
He was a perfectionist.
[Arnold] You train together, help each other.
You even help each other pumping up backstage with the towels,
and you oil each other up.
You put the oil on me because I cannot reach in the back.
Someone has to put the oil on my back.
That's what you do. You help each other.
And then before you go out, you say, "Good luck."
translation.ko: 그리고 무대에 나가기 전에 행운을 빌어 주죠

translation.en: I used to say, "Good luck," and "I'm going to beat you."
translation.ko: 그러면서 내가 이길 거라고 덧붙이곤 했어요

translation.en: [Arnold] I was never a fanatic about diet.
translation.ko: 전 한 번도 식단에 집착한 적 없었어요

translation.en: It was Frank Zane and Franco Columbu
who put my vitamins together.
And then we would experiment with steroids.
Everybody in the bodybuilding field who is up there on the top
translation.ko: 보디빌딩 바닥에서 정상에 있는 사람은 전부 다

translation.en: is taking steroids.
Maybe five percent of my progress
is from the steroids.
I had doctor's supervision.
You stayed with a very strict rule of doing it four months a year
translation.ko: 철저하게 규칙을 세워 대회를 앞두고 1년에 4개월간 복용한 뒤 끊었습니다

translation.en: before a competition, and then lay off.
So I changed my eating habits and everything.
I got really tanned.
If your whole personality is to show off,
you can't wait to show people what you have.
translation.ko: 가진 것을 남들에게 보여 주려고 안달하죠

translation.en: There were hundreds of people watching guys work out.
translation.ko: 남자들이 운동하는 모습을 수백 명이 지켜봤어요

translation.en: [Arnold] I felt like I was living in the middle of a circus.
So you were getting it all times,
the satisfaction of people watching you
and saying, "Wow, he looks incredible."
[woman] It was the summer of '69.
I was working as a hostess at Zucky's Deli.
He came over to me and he said,
"You are so sexy."
"I need to ask you out on a date."
With a really thick accent.
translation.ko: "바버라 아웃랜드 베이커 작가, '아놀드와 나'" 억양이 정말 강했어요

translation.en: Barely 100 words in his vocabulary.
He was handsome. He was magnetic.
He was charismatic.
He was just different.
When he arrived for our date, I was watching the moon landing.
translation.ko: 데이트 날 아놀드가 왔을 때 전 달 착륙을 보고 있었어요

translation.en: So we watched it together. We took photos in front of the television.
translation.ko: 우린 방송을 같이 봤고 TV 앞에서 사진도 찍었죠

translation.en: [man 2 over radio] Tranquility base here. The eagle has landed.
[Barbara] After our first date,
we saw each other all the time that we could.
He created laughter everywhere.
He was just so
mesmerizing.
[Arnold] Barbara was the first time
that I saw, through her, kind of how America celebrates Christmas,
translation.ko: 미국인들이 크리스마스를 어떻게 지내는지 보게 됐어요

translation.en: because she would take me home,
and the family would just be so inclusive.
It was the first time
in my life that I ever celebrated a birthday,
when Barbara's mother made a birthday cake.
translation.ko: 바버라의 어머니가 생일 케이크를 만들어 주셨죠

translation.en: I never got a cake. No one ever sang "Happy Birthday" or anything.
translation.ko: 그 전까진 케이크를 받거나 생일 축하 노래를 들은 적 없어요

translation.en: I don't know why.
It gave me another way of really appreciating
the American way of life,
and to have a normal life.
But with my family…
The communication with my parents was not good.
And my brother…
I kind of erased him out of my mind
for years during my bodybuilding years.
I felt like I was creating my own life over here,
and I wanted nothing to do with my past life.
Joe Weider was interested in trying to figure out how does he sell me.
translation.ko: 조 위더는 절 어떤 이미지로 팔지 궁리했고

translation.en: So he came up with this idea
that I'm this German machine.
No emotions, just marching forward,
translation.ko: 감정 없이 그저 전진하는 독일 기계

translation.en: and it's going to make me the champion.
And I loved it, because that's what I saw myself,
translation.ko: 저도 절 그렇게 봤기에 마음에 들었습니다

translation.en: as someone that couldn't be stopped.
Joe Weider had one goal in mind, and that is that I win every competition.
translation.ko: 조 위더의 목표는 제가 모든 대회를 휩쓸고

translation.en: That I'm on the cover of his magazine.
That I sell a shitload of food supplements for him.
translation.ko: 조의 식품 보조제를 불티나게 파는 거였습니다

translation.en: And that everything that I did,
he would use the name Weider for it.
So when I came up with
splitting my bicep training with my tricep training,
translation.ko: 이두 운동과 삼두 운동을 분리한 운동법을 개발했을 때

translation.en: he called it The Weider Split Routine.
translation.ko: 조는 위더 스플릿 루틴이라고 이름 붙였죠

translation.en: So that was the deal.
[Weider] I'm just gonna go over this.
You should have unique pictures taken, Arnold.
Make it look different.
I had to go and work with him and say,
"Joe, you're selling your products. You're making millions of dollars."
translation.ko: '조, 당신 제품을 팔아서 떼돈을 벌고 있잖아요'

translation.en: "I want to also sell some products of mine."
"All I need from you is give me advertisement space in your magazine."
I wanted to make money and I wanted to turn one dollar into two.
translation.ko: 전 돈을 벌고 싶었어요 1달러를 2달러로 불리고 싶었죠

translation.en: And I wanted to learn how to do that in America the American way.
translation.ko: 미국식으로 돈 버는 법을 배우고 싶었어요

translation.en: I said to Joe Weider,
"Can you help me? I want to go to college to learn English."
"Then I wanna take some business classes,
because eventually I may have to take over your operation."
translation.ko: '결국엔 내가 당신 사업을 이어받게 될지 모르잖아요'

translation.en: And he loved that.
These are the new covers.
[Arnold] Let me see it.
We don't want to put him on the cover. Come on, Joe.
translation.ko: 이 친구는 표지에 안 돼요 알잖아요

translation.en: You told me one time that you're only putting Mr. Universes or Mr. Olympias on the cover. [Joe] Five more copies…
[Arnold] Joe?
[Arnold] Every time I want anything,
I say to myself, "Okay, now what's the next thing?"
If you're always hungry, you're never really satisfied.
translation.ko: 늘 굶주려 있으면 절대 만족하는 법이 없죠

translation.en: Because Reg Park, of course, won three Mr. Universe contests,
translation.ko: 레지 파크가 세 차례 미스터 유니버스가 됐으니

translation.en: Arnold has to break that record.
When people think, "This is too much." For me, it was definitely not enough.
translation.ko: 남들이 무리라고 하는 것도 제겐 부족했어요

translation.en: And then I wanted more.
[Jon Jon] My dad had retired,
but he decided to compete in Mr. Universe.
At that time, my dad was 42.
Arnold was 23.
[Arnold] Someone told me, "Do you know who else is competing this year?"
And I say, "Who?"
They said, "Reg Park."
I said, "Come on. This is impossible."
I felt kind of weird to compete against my idol.
And then won.
When that happened, it was something really weird that happened mentally to me.
translation.ko: 우승이 결정됐을 때 제 심경에 정말 이상한 변화가 일어났어요

translation.en: I felt guilty somewhat.
That my ego got in the way or maybe I shouldn't have competed that year.
translation.ko: 제 자존심 문제 아니면 그해 출전한 게 잘못이었던 거죠

translation.en: To know that, as a 15-year-old kid, you were dreaming about that
and you were idolizing it.
And now, all of a sudden, you become the one
translation.ko: 이제 갑자기 제가 그 대상이 된 겁니다

translation.en: that others are idolizing.
I made this vision become a reality.
My mind is just geared differently. You know, it's geared towards moving forward.
translation.ko: 제 정신은 작동 방식이 남달라요 무조건 앞을 향하죠

translation.en: [Arnold] What is the new thing?
A new challenge. A new mountain to climb.
translation.ko: 새로운 도전 새로이 넘어야 할 산 말이죠

translation.en: Mr. Universe is a world championship title,
translation.ko: 미스터 유니버스는 세계 선수권 대회 타이틀이지만

translation.en: but every year there's a Mr. Universe.
But who is really, then, the best?
[Arnold] So Joe Weider created the Mr. Olympia,
translation.ko: 그래서 조 위더는 미스터 올림피아를 만들었고

translation.en: where all the Mr. Universes and all the world champions
competes in the Mr. Olympia.
If you win that, then you can call yourself the best.
translation.ko: 거기서 우승하면 진짜 최고가 되는 거예요

translation.en: Pow!
Mr. Olympia!
The year 1969, that was my first Mr. Olympia.
It was a different league.
I competed against Sergio Oliva.
I lost against him.
He was better than me.
I gave him a big kiss on stage,
and I said, "Enjoy it, because this is the last time."
The next year I came back with vengeance.
I had to kind of make him the villain,
to go and train harder and harder and harder.
I finally got the chance to confront him.
I then pulled a little trick on him.
We were doing pose-off after pose-off.
And then I said to him, "I think it's enough."
"I think they must know by now
who is going to be the winner."
He says, "You're right," and then he walked off.
translation.ko: 세르히오도 그런 것 같다며 무대에서 내려갔어요

translation.en: And then I pointed at him, like, "He's giving up."
translation.ko: 전 세르히오가 포기했다는 듯한 손짓을 했죠

translation.en: So it was like a psychological little trick to kind of close the deal once and for all.
translation.ko: 완전히 쐐기를 박는 심리적 속임수였던 셈이죠

translation.en: He turned around and said, "You son of a bitch."
[chuckles] He was, like, really pissed off about it.
[Arnold] In the '70s, I kept being driven to go from title to title.
I was so far ahead of everybody else that I ran over everybody.
translation.ko: 전 모두를 제치고 월등히 앞서 나갔죠

translation.en: ♪ Super guy ♪
♪ Oh ♪
-[man] What do you expect to see tonight? -[man 2] I'm not quite sure.
I'm curious to see what it's… what it looks like.
[man 3] Can we ask what you expect tonight? I expect to see fantastic bodybuilders.
translation.ko: - 오늘 뭘 보러 오셨나요? - 멋진 보디빌더들요

translation.en: -[man 3] Have you ever been to one before? -No.
translation.ko: - 이런 행사에 오신 적 있나요? - 아뇨

translation.en: -[man 3] Have you ever been to one before? -Never!
translation.ko: - 이런 행사에 오신 적 있나요? - 전혀요

translation.en: -Have you? -[man 3] Never.
[Arnold] Being a bodybuilder is like being an artist,
being a sculptor like Rodin or Michelangelo,
because you have to have a sense of symmetry and beauty.
[Arnold] If you don't have that, the whole thing together
translation.ko: 그런 감각이 없다면 아무리 해 봤자

translation.en: looks like a waste of time.
[man] That's it. Hold it.
That's it. Just hold it.
[man 2] Looks a little different than two months ago, doesn't it?
translation.ko: 두 달 전보다 좀 달라 보이네

translation.en: [Arnold] I never really was satisfied with my body.
translation.ko: 전 제 몸에 만족한 적이 한 번도 없었어요

translation.en: God almighty.
I looked in the mirror and said to myself, "I don't know how this shit body
translation.ko: 거울을 보며 말했죠 '어떻게 이런 거지 같은 몸으로'

translation.en: can ever win this competition."
-Thanks for coming in. -Lou Ferrigno is coming too.
translation.ko: - 와 줘서 고마워 - 루 페리그노도 와

translation.en: [Arnold] When I brag about myself, that's all bullshit.
-All right. -Very dramatic, Arnold.
[Arnold] This is kind of like the other me, the me that I want the world to see.
translation.ko: 세상에 보여 주는 또 다른 자신 같은 거죠

translation.en: Take this one.
That should inspire you, because this is an arm shot.
translation.ko: 팔 포즈니까 보고 느끼는 게 있을 거야

translation.en: It's Columbu.
How do you like that shot?
[Arnold] But in reality, when I'm by myself,
I look at it and I say to myself,
"It's not there yet. It's not happening."
Check the chest.
[Arnold] I think it's the very thing that made me always be on the edge
and always want more.
Your chest looks tremendous, Arnold.
Huge.
I was in Baltimore and Philadelphia
doing, uh, posing exhibitions.
I came home,
and, uh, Franco said to me… He says, you know, "I have bad news."
I said, "What's that?"
He said to me… he says, "Your brother died in a car accident."
"He was drunk driving,
and that he was hitting a telephone pole."
And I was, like, stunned.
[Arnold] He was always the darling of the family.
He was very artistic.
Very smart.
Read a lot.
But I don't think my brother ever was really happy.
translation.ko: 하지만 형이 행복하진 않았던 것 같아요

translation.en: I think he started drinking because our upbringing was very tough.
translation.ko: 힘든 어린 시절 때문에 형이 술을 시작한 것 같아요

translation.en: The brutality that was at home,
the beatings that we got from our parents sometimes,
all of this, I think he could not sustain,
translation.ko: 형은 이 모든 걸 견딜 수 없었던 거예요

translation.en: that punishment.
He was much more delicate of a person
by nature.
We had a very, kind of, schizophrenic behavior
that my brother and I witnessed at home.
There was the kind father,
and then there was the other times where my father would come home drunk.
translation.ko: 어떨 땐 술에 취한 채 집에 들어와요

translation.en: And he would scream at three in the morning.
We would wake up,
and, all of a sudden, you know, our hearts were pounding,
because we knew what that meant.
That he could, at any given time, strike my mother
or go crazy.
So there was this kind of strange violence.
The kind of upbringing that we had
was beneficial for someone like me,
who was, inside, very strong and very determined.
translation.ko: 내면이 아주 강하고 심지가 굳은 사람에겐요

translation.en: But my brother was more fragile.
Nietzsche was right,
that that what does not kill you, will make you stronger.
translation.ko: 날 죽이지 못하는 것은 날 더 강하게 만들었어요

translation.en: The very thing that made me who I am today
was the very thing that destroyed him.
[Arnold] In 1972, when I was competing in Essen, in Germany,
translation.ko: 1972년 독일 에센에서 열린 대회에 출전했을 때

translation.en: my parents came for really
unexplained reasons.
I competed at least 50 times
in weightlifting competitions, in powerlifting competitions,
in locals and in statewide competitions,
national competitions.
My parents never came to any of it.
So that's why I was quite surprised.
My father acted a little odd.
He was a little slower. He was sometimes slurring things.
translation.ko: 행동이 좀 굼뜨고 말이 어눌할 때도 있었죠

translation.en: And so there was something off a little bit there.
A few weeks later,
I got a phone call
that my father had a stroke.
I, uh, then took the next flight to Austria
and then went to visit my father in the hospital.
He was not able to communicate.
You know, he needed a lot of medical attention,
but I did not know is this something you can overcome or not.
translation.ko: 이게 회복 가능한 상태인지 가늠이 안 됐어요

translation.en: That I did not know.
I flew back to Los Angeles,
and then after that, he passed away.
[Arnold] When my father and my brother died,
I had no feelings about it.
You know? I eliminated it.
It maybe comes out sometimes in my life later on…
translation.ko: 나중에 세월이 흘러서는 어떤 감정이 들 수도 있겠지만

translation.en: those feelings, you know, but I don't know.
translation.ko: 나중에 세월이 흘러서는 어떤 감정이 들 수도 있겠지만 지금은 모르겠어요

translation.en: I've been training myself to do that.
Not to be affected by anything else from the outside.
translation.ko: 외부의 어떤 것에도 영향을 받지 않도록요

translation.en: I mean,
I'm not an expert
in psychology or anything like that.
All I can tell you is that
when you're a person that has always a goal,
that always has a mission,
the less time that you have to think about, "How do I feel today?"
translation.ko: 이런 생각을 할 시간이 적어져요 '오늘 내 기분이 어떤가?'

translation.en: "Am I depressed today?"
"Do I feel sorry for myself?"
"Have I become a victim?"
"Oh my God. I feel so bad about myself," and all this.
I don't have time for this crap. A lot of times, it's people didn't work enough.
translation.ko: 그럴 시간이 없죠 보통 그런 노력들을 잘 안 해요

translation.en: If you're busy all the time,
you don't have time to think about this stuff.
Let's just move forward. Move. Move. Move. Move.
[Arnold] When I realized that bodybuilding is not established,
translation.ko: 보디빌딩이 생소한 분야라는 걸 깨달았을 때

translation.en: I decided that I'm gonna promote the hell out of myself.
[man] What are the judges looking for?
[Arnold] Well, they're looking for proportions, symmetry, the size of the muscles,
how you can pose and present the muscles.
translation.ko: 어떻게 포즈를 잡고 근육을 표현하는지를 보죠

translation.en: I want to put some effort out to help people understand what the sport is all about.
translation.ko: 보디빌딩이라는 종목을 이해하는 데 도움이 되면 좋겠어요

translation.en: -[man] Got everything in the chair now? -No, there was a problem.
translation.ko: - 의자에 전부 챙겨 놨나요? - 아뇨, 문제가 있었어요

translation.en: -I see. -[audience laughs]
[Arnold] I've only been in this country five years.
translation.ko: 이 나라에 온 지 5년밖에 안 돼서 그러는데

translation.en: What does it mean, "hanky-panky?"
-My goodness. -[laughing]
♪ I wonder, wonder… ♪
[Arnold] It's a sport. I'm competing to be the best in it.
translation.ko: 보디빌딩은 스포츠고 전 최고가 되고자 경쟁해요

translation.en: And I feel that, at the same time, I'm an artist.
I'm creating a body that wasn't there before.
[Albert] In '74, Arnold was in fantastic shape,
and he was absolutely unbeatable.
[Arnold] In 1974, I won the Mr. Olympia competition.
So I won, all together, 13 world bodybuilding championships,
one after the next…
because I was driven by this vision.
What else was there to do?
To win another one?
Boring.
So I stopped.
I mean, I'm competing now for 10 years.
translation.ko: 제가 선수 생활을 한 지 10년이 됐습니다

translation.en: And after 10 years, I feel like it's enough, you know?
translation.ko: 10년이 지나니 할 만큼 한 것 같아요

translation.en: You have to let other people have a chance
and, uh, just leave as a winner.
[announcer] Ladies and gentlemen, Arnold Schwarzenegger!
[Arnold] It's a sport and I love to compete.
And, uh, I love to be the best in the world.
You know, just the best.
To stand up there and know that there is no other man
translation.ko: 지금 이 분야에서 그 누구보다 내가

translation.en: better in this particular field than I am.
And, um, so I think it's such a repetitious thing now,
that I would like to go on to another thing,
and, uh, you know, try to be the best in something else.
[man] Like what?
I would like to get into acting.
Find out if I can be good in that.
[man] I remember being on the phone.
[Arnold] Hello?
[man] I said…
Tell me about your process as an actor.
He said, "Jim."
"I don't want to be an actor."
"I want to be a star."
